What's the best song to play in a trailer?While You Were Sleeping  Sam Hodde/Getty ImagesSeries-clinching free throwsSometimes a big game comes down to a hail mary, a walkoff home run or a half-court lob. Sometimes it’s decided by the little things.Last night, the Mavericks eliminated the Thunder  and advanced to the Western Conference finals for the second time in three years. Luka Dončić had a triple-double and Kyrie Irving and Derrick Jones Jr. scored 22 each, but the take-home moment was P.J. Washingtonnailing two free throws  with 2.5 seconds left to make it 117-116. Fundamentals, kids. Dallas awaits the winner of today’s Wolves-Nuggets Game 7, and now that the Mavs have become a complete team on both ends of the floor, they’re absolutely a threat to win it all. Meanwhile, OKC falls far short of the goals established by their No. 1 seed, though this season as a whole was an enormous success for this young roster.Back and forth on the iceThrough six games, the Oilers and Canucks have alternated victories each time. Last night was Edmonton’s turn, cruising to a 5-1 victory at home due to — who else? —Connor McDavid breaking loose  with three assists.Game 7 on Monday in Vancouver. Will the pattern continue, sending the Canucks to the conference finals, or can the Oilers make it two in a row? Winner gets the Stars. Enjoying sports these days, Dallas fans?A Special Offer Try out The Athletic at a special rateWant access  to hundreds of sports journalists, breaking news, features, chats, andthousands of stories you won't get anywhere else? We have a special offer . Subscribe  News to Know  Richard Pelham/Getty ImagesTyson Fury goes downOleksandr Usyk became boxing’s first-ever four-belt undisputed heavyweight champion with a split-decision win over Tyson Fury last night. Afterward, in peak boxing pettiness, Fury blamed the decision on sympathy for Ukraine, Usyk’s home country. Never change, boxing. A mountain ofgreat coverage here .  A stacked major leaderboardCollin Morikawa and Xander Schauffele (15-under-par) will head to Valhalla Golf Club tied for the lead at the PGA Championship and play togetherin the final pairing , but seven other players are within four shots of them.Live updates here are loaded .Elsewhere, the arresting officer of Scottie Scheffler didn’t have his body cam on . 🤔 More below on Scheffler's deeply strange Friday. One more: Here is everything you need to knowon who can actually win .   More news * Shota Imanaga is doing absolutely absurd things  in Chicago. TheCubs 30-year-old “rookie” now has an ERA of .84 through nine starts. Cool stuff. * Seize The Grey won the Preakness . No Triple Crown. But all horses survived, which is a win. * Simone Biles was in reminder mode last night  on her status as Olympics favorite, thoughGabby Douglas withdrew  from the Core Hydration Classic amid her own Olympic comeback attempt. * The WNBA is investigating sponsorship bonuses  received by Las Vegas Aces players. *  NASCAR’s Kyle Larson is in the top 12 for Indy 500 qualifying , setting up a rare “double” attempt. *  The Maple Leafs hired Craig Berube as the team’s next head coach . *  Friday, EA Sports dropped loads of College Football 25 details . We are so back. Watchthis version of the trailer , and maybe catch a feeling or two. * The Benedictine Sisters aren’t too hyped about Harrison Butker . Never typed that before.Pulse Polls Netflix and the NFL’s new TV realityThe NBA can search for rich new TV deals, college football can reorganize the entire sport around TV contracts, baseball can change its rules, but nothing gets in the way of the only true axiom of our sports world: the NFL is king.Go look at any metric and find NFL viewership through the roof. Hell, we see it here in our own Pulse numbers. The general American sports consumer is largely most interested in the NFL. Such is life.The NFL’s deal with Netflix, announced last week , is a new reach for the king, though. Jacob Robinson and Dianna Russini touched on this over inScoop City  on Thursday, but I want to emphasize a few things:The NFL’s TV contracts now span seven different networks if you include major broadcast companies (NBC, CBS, FOX, ESPN) and streamers (Amazon Prime, Peacock, Netflix).A generous look at the financials gives the total bill for watching every NFL football game this season atjust under $1,000 . That is wild to me, and that calculation is surely the lowest possible total for anyone trying to achieve that goal.Is that … too much? My initial thought is yes, but then again, viewers flocked to Peacock last year  to watch a playoff game. What is telling the NFL to not expand as much as possible?So yes, of course the NFL is airing two games on Christmas Day . Just two years ago that would’ve seemed preposterous, both schedulingmultiple NFL games on a Wednesday and encroaching on the NBA’s Christmas Day territory. This is ruthless stuff.We want to know what you think, though. How does the NFL’s Netflix deal make you feel? Possible answers: * Too many channels! It’s hard to find my team. * Other sports are worse.Make your voice heard here . We’ll discuss the results tomorrow.A Little Awkward  Is Manchester City an asterisk in the EPL?Barring a minor miracle, a few hours from now Manchester City will celebrate their fourth consecutive EPL title. Amazing achievement! What else is amazing? As our (brilliant) Athletic FC newsletter detailed  on Friday, City have some questions to sort through, namely, an astonishing level of accusations that they broke the rules, and over the entirety of the current dynasty: The charges: Manchester City are facing 115 – ONE HUNDRED AND FIFTEEN – charges of financial fair play rules breaches,across NINE seasons. Explainer here .The timing: We don’t yet know when, or even if, the hammer will drop. But … 115 charges? It will, right? Any college sports fans know how this works. If the hammer drops … did it actually drop? Vacated wins, whatever that is. A banner or two come down. The dreaded asterisk. Some vindication from rivals. BUT … the champagne celebration in a few hours won’t feel different, right? Perhaps at least, as Oliver Kay explains, a coach and adynasty will face a legacy reckoning . We’ll see. Follow the scores live , andsign up for The Athletic FC here. A Little Awkward Golf: PGA Championship 1 p.m. ET on ESPNThis leaderboard is absolutely loaded. Can Xander Schauffele, Viktor Hovland or Sahith Theegala break through for a first major? Does Bryson pull one for LIV? Does Rory, Justin or (gulp) Scottie go nuclear? Anything could happen. (Safe money is probably Morikawa.)NBA: 🔥 Game 7s!! 🔥3:30 and 7 p.m. ET on ABC and TNTEither the Knicks or Pacers will face the Celtics in the Eastern Conference Finals.Click. Either the Denver Nuggets are alive for a run at a repeat, or we see an all-time changing of the guard.Click.Get tickets to games like these here .  “The most shocking day in golf major championship history began with a tragedy, and sawScottie Scheffler, the No. 1 male player in the world, arrested, booked into a local jail and released in time to tee off.” Brody Miller, Gabby Herzig and Jim Trotterexamine all the details  of a truly bizarre Friday morning.Another French star as the No. 1 pick in the NBA Draft?
